intro: Laplacea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy laplacea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typical of the Asteraceae family. Laplacea pubescens is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
